ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Digest Number 103
ygData.msgSnippet: i too experience this bit of parting ways with friends due to playing styles. only, it was my bf (who intro d me to eq) who went the way of the buffalo. i d
ygData.messageBody:
i too experience this bit of parting ways with friends due to playing
styles. only, it was my bf (who intro'd me to eq) who went the way of the
buffalo. i'd rather relax, socialize, whatnot, then get mad at things not
going my way, dying, etc. i had to tell him to stop playing with me as i'd
rather our rl relationship to work.

i am an avid rp'er, only outside of eq. i am curious as to how some of you
go about making your characters come to life. *smiles*

as for online rp'ing...
try monarchy.shareplay.com -> braggarts hall
it's a turn based game, and very simple compared to eq. it's guild based, or
not. i enjoy it a lot and have been part of that family for over a year -
though i have set my kingdoms aside. any questions, and i'd gladly answer.

btw - i am very new to this list, and i must say, so far, i'm very impressed.

lynnara starspinner
dominant lioness,
the lion's share
e'ci server





>Message: 1
> Date: Mon, 08 May 2000 17:50:48 -0400
> From: "Zuki Vekk" <zuki@...>
>Subject: Re: EQ then and now
>
>My EQ partner and I discuss these issues alot. We're both non-competitive,
have as much fun as you can, love-to-explore-and-do-quests kinda gals. We've
both been playing for well over a year and our primaries are still low
thirties.
>
>The saddest issue I've had to come to terms with in EQ is my friends who in
the early days used to love to do all the above mentioned, but have since
become power levellers and (shudders as she says it) *Kewl Lewt* campers.
From what used to be a friends list that was always crammed with 20 names,
its down to low teens now as my friends have slowly turned away from the fun
playing times we used to have. A couple of "Bless-Yer-Heart" friends have
played as we always have and I thank the Gods for them, they've kept me
playing EQ. The others I have learned to wish the best and let them go their
own way without any hurt feelings.
>
>You know, the most amazing part to me is when I do group with strangers and
do my role-playing thing, within the hour, all but the hard-core powergamers
are rp'ing back with me and having a blast. Go figure.
>
>So, would I play a RP-devoted on-line game. Where the heck do I sign up?
>
>Zuki
>Tunare Server
>
>
>
>Angelfire for your free web-based e-mail. http://www.angelfire.com
>
